intro: Eschweilera tapuya, commonly known as the "tapuya beauty," is a species of tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, white to pink flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable to extinction.
